text:
Hi, all. First of all, happy new year! :tada:

I'm working on moving TuringModels.jl to a static site. A preview is available at <https://github.com/rikhuijzer/TuringModels.jl/tree/franklin>. Is there anyone here who knows how I can get rid of some code duplication between the models, for example, <https://github.com/rikhuijzer/TuringModels.jl/blob/franklin/models/multinomial-poisson.md> and <https://github.com/rikhuijzer/TuringModels.jl/blob/franklin/models/height.md>

elements.text: Hi, all. First of all, happy new year!
I'm working on moving TuringModels.jl to a static site. A preview is available at
. Is there anyone here who knows how I can get rid of some code duplication between the models, for example,
and

text: While keeping the outputted page the same. I'm trying to make the code on each page be stand alone

elements.text: While keeping the outputted page the same. I'm trying to make the code on each page be stand alone

text:
well you can define  a function in `utils.jl` , which does the stuff that all pages need and just `hide` it .  E.g. something like:

```function foo()
  # setup stuff needed on all pages
end```
then just do

```Utils.foo() # hide```
at the top of the page.

text: you could even have a command `\turingsetup` which runs the `Utils.foo` codeblock, you’d put the definition in  your `config.md`

text: Good idea. Thanks for the explanation
